visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: 'Temperature Variation', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for the title and labels, with a font size of 14px for the title and 12px for the labels, Data series: The data series should include a single series named 'Temperature' with the data points [-10, -5, 0, 5, 10, 15, 10, 10, 5, 0, -5], Custom colors: Use the colors #f7a35c for values below 0, #7cb5ec for values between 0 and 10, and #90ed7d for values above 10, Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray color (#f0f0f0), add a legend with the title 'Legend', and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a spline chart with a title 'Temperature Variation'. The chart type is set to 'spline', and the background color is light gray (#f0f0f0) with margins of 50 pixels on all sides. The title and axis labels are styled with a dark gray color (#333) and specific font sizes. The data series includes a single series named 'Temperature' with data points ranging from -10 to 15. The series uses custom colors to differentiate zones: values below 0 are colored #f7a35c, values between 0 and 10 are colored #7cb5ec, and values above 10 are colored #90ed7d. Additionally, a legend with the title 'Legend' is included to provide context for the data series.
